page.title: 04AGRICULTURE
page.content: The principal land use is farming and the are abounds ln small mixed and dairy farms, most of them owner- occupied. Small herds of dairy cattle (mainly Fresians) graze the pastures ln summer, when other fields are cut for hay and silage to provide their winter feed. The cattle are wintered in barns. There is some rearing of beef cattle and some sturdy Pennine sheep occupy the moorland. The area was once much richer on sheep in the days when woollen cloth was manufac_ turered locally. Many small farms also have free range poultry, and occasionally goats and pigs. In the East of the area which is less exposed the land use changes slightly; crops of barley and a few of potatoes predominate over the grazing land. Throughout the area there are no hedges and few fences. The ancient
